messages.subject: guilt (was/is Re: Book)
messages.msgSnippet: ... You think guilt will motivate me? BINGO! It s always been the primary   motivator of my life.    Now it s my fault your kids can t get on the computer,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/12/05 8:18:18 AM, deedeanne@... writes:


> Anyway, a book would save
> me some on computer paper, ink, and allow others in my family more
> computer time.<g> We're still managing with one computer in a family
> of 5, believe it or not.
>

You think guilt will motivate me?
BINGO!
It's always been the primary motivator of my life. <g>
Now it's my fault your kids can't get on the computer, and NOW I feel bad.

<g>

Really.


Not really.

No, it's true.


(Anyone who has a mental picture of Eddie Izzard doing the nodding and
"really" face and then the shaking of head and "not really" face, insert a series of
that here.)

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
